description: Chef Liu grew up in Beijing, China and has been cooking professionally for over 20 years. He specializes in traditional Chinese cuisine and is known for his exceptional knife skills and ability to create beautiful, intricate dishes.
cooking_method1: 1. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch. 2. Stir-fry chicken until cooked through. 3. Remove chicken and stir-fry peanuts, chili peppers, and ginger. 4. Add chicken back to the pan and stir-fry with the other ingredients. 5. Serve over rice.
ingredients2: 1 sheet nori seaweed, cut into small pieces
cooking_method2:
1. In a pot, bring the dashi or chicken broth to a simmer. 
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the miso paste with a ladleful of the hot broth until smooth. 
3. Add the miso mixture to the pot and stir to combine. 
4. Add the tofu and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through. 
5. Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with the green onions and nori seaweed.
ingredients3: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Soy sauce and grated daikon for serving
cooking_method3:
1. In a bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt. 
2. Gradually whisk in the ice-cold water until the batter is smooth. 
3. Heat the oil in a large pot or deep fryer to 375째F. 
4. Dip the shrimp in the batter, letting any excess batter drip off. 
5. Fry the shrimp in the hot oil for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. 
6. Drain on paper towels and serve with soy sauce and grated daikon.

description: Chef Li Ming is a celebrated chef from Sichuan province, known for his bold and spicy Sichuan-style dishes. He has won numerous awards for his cooking and has trained under some of China's most renowned chefs.
cooking_method1: 1. Cut beef into thin slices and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch. 2. Blanch broccoli in boiling water. 3. Stir-fry garlic and beef until browned. 4. Add broccoli and stir-fry for another minute. 5. Serve over rice.
cooking_method2: 1. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch. 2. Stir-fry chicken until cooked through. 3. Remove chicken and stir-fry peanuts, chili peppers, and ginger. 4. Add chicken back to the pan and stir-fry with the other ingredients. 5. Serve over rice.
cooking_method3: 1. Brown pork in a wok with garlic and doubanjiang. 2. Add tofu, chicken broth, and Sichuan peppercorns. 3. Thicken sauce with cornstarch. 4. Garnish with green onions. 5. Serve with rice.

description: Chef Chen Wei is a master of Cantonese cuisine, with over 30 years of experience. He is known for his delicate and flavorful dishes, using only the freshest ingredients and traditional cooking techniques.
cooking_method1: 1. Cut tofu, bamboo shoots, and mushrooms into small pieces. 2. Beat eggs in a bowl. 3. Boil chicken stock and add the tofu, bamboo shoots, and mushrooms. 4. Add cornstarch and water mixture to thicken the soup. 5. Pour beaten eggs into the soup while stirring. 6. Add rice vinegar and serve hot.
